abstract.p: Howard Goldberg reviews Loire sauvignon blanc, Gascon white, southern red and cabernet-syrah blend from Vinival of Valet, France; photo (M)

block.p: THE almost invisible rear labels say ''Drink and Eat Selections.'' A slightly known producer, Vinival, in Valet, France, has nearly hidden its name. Only entry-level drinkers from another planet might miss the point of the wines.

Illustrations of fish, accompanied by the words ''fish,'' ''pescado,'' ''poisson'' and ''pesce,'' swim around the bottle of '98 Loire sauvignon blanc. On a '98 Gascon white, a chardonnay-colombard blend, the decoration is a fat bird with ''chicken,'' ''pollo,'' ''poulet.''

THE almost invisible rear labels say ''Drink and Eat Selections.'' A slightly known producer, Vinival, in Valet, France, has nearly hidden its name. Only entry-level drinkers from another planet might miss the point of the wines.

Illustrations of fish, accompanied by the words ''fish,'' ''pescado,'' ''poisson'' and ''pesce,'' swim around the bottle of '98 Loire sauvignon blanc. On a '98 Gascon white, a chardonnay-colombard blend, the decoration is a fat bird with ''chicken,'' ''pollo,'' ''poulet.''

One southern red (a '98 merlot-cabernet sauvignon combo) features a smiling steer with ''beef,'' ''boeuf,'' ''ternera.'' On another, a '98 cabernet-syrah blend, a sheep alternates with illustrations of chops: ''lamb,'' ''agnello,'' ''agnelet.''

The importer, Robert S. Mautner of Tri Vin, in Mount Vernon, says these back-to-basics wines sell like gangbusters in European supermarkets, where customers want ''Beber y Comer,'' ''Trinken und Essen'' and ''Bere e Mangiare.''

All four appealing wines are three tweaks above vin ordinaire. The sauvignon is crisp and grapefruity; the chardonnay-colombard, a nippy thirst-slaker; the merlot-cabernet, robust and comfy; the cabernet-syrah, a chunky brew.

The following shops all charge $8 for the wines: Deprez Wines, 454 South Riverside Avenue, Croton-on-Hudson; Wine Seller, 134 Bedford Road, Katonah; Budget Liquors, 111 East Main Street, Elmsford; and Wine and Spirits at Cheers, 1070-72 Wilmot Road, Scarsdale.
